document.heading: Resolution Number TMBC1523-09-24 of the Duly Elected and Certified Governing Body of the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians

citations.citation: Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians Res. No. 1523-09-24

recital.text: the Turtle Mountain Band of Chippewa Indians, hereinafter referred to as the Tribe, is an unincorporated Band acting under a revised Constitution and By-Laws approved by the Secretary of the Interior on June 16th, 1959, and amendments approved; and

Article IX (a) Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and By-Laws empowers the Tribal Council with the authority to represent the Band and to negotiate with Federal, State, and Local Governments and with private persons; and

Article VII Section 1 of the Turtle Mountain Constitution and Bylaws requires a 30-day comment period prior to the adoption of any ordinances or amendments to the Tribal Code, whether proposed by resolution or otherwise. Adoption must occur through a roll call vote of the Tribal Council at a publicly held meeting; and
The Tribe placed out for public comment, proposed amendments to Title 38, the Tribal Traffic Code, 38.0206 and 38.0228; and
two provisions of the traffic code do not clearly state penalties for the offenses, specifically 38.0206 and 38.0228; and
38.0206 of the traffic code do not clearly differentiate between reckless driving and aggravated reckless driving; and
no comments were received on the aforementioned proposed amendments to the Tribal Traffic Code Title 38; and
that the Tribe is approving amendments to the Tribal Traffic Code, Title 38, Sections 38.0206 and 38.0228; now
that the Tribal Code will be codified accordingly.

section.heading: Reckless Driving; Aggravated Reckless Driving; Penalty

para.text: Any person shall be guilty of reckless driving if he or she drives a vehicle:
Recklessly in disregard of the rights or safety of others; or
Without due caution and circumspection and circumspection and at a speed or in a manner so as to endanger or be likely to endanger any person or the property of another.
A person found guilty of reckless driving shall be subject to a penalty of a Class 3 offense as defined in Title 26.
Any person shall be guilty of aggravated reckless driving if he or she drives a vehicle:
Recklessly in disregard of the rights or safety of others and causes injury to property or person; or

Without due caution and circumspection and circumspection and at a speed or in a manger as to endanger or be likely to endanger any person or the property of another and cause injury to property or person.
A person found guilty of aggravated reckless driving shall be subject to a penalty of a Class 4 offense as defined in Title 26.

section.heading: Fleeing or Attempting to Elude a Peace Officer
section.text: Any driver of a motor vehicle who willfully fails or refuses to bring the vehicle to a stop, or who otherwise flees or attempts to elude, in any manner, a pursuing police vehicle or peace officer, when given a visual or audible signal to bring the vehicle to a stop. A signal complies with this section if the signal is perceptible to the driver and:

para.text: If given from a vehicle, the signal is given by hand, voice, emergency light, or siren, and the stopping vehicle is appropriately marked showing it to be an official police vehicle; or
If not given from a vehicle, the signal is given by hand, voice, emergency light, or siren, and the officer is in uniform and prominently displays the officer's badge of office.
